defs: the tree Maba buxifolia of Ebenaceae family.
a person who is intolerant of otheṛs wealth, well-being, status, happiness, etc.
to have ill-will or intolerance at the superiority, success or good fortune of others; to envy.
a feeling of resentful or discontented longing aroused by or intolerance for another person's better fortune, situation, etc.
a person having such a feeling or intolerance.
the quality of an envious person.
action; work; deed.
execution; performance.
obligtory duty.
the results of one's past action, deeds, etc.; the effect.
the supposed unchangeable course of life determined by one's past deeds.
a many-storied building.
any of the stories above the ground floor of a building.
= ಕರುಮ.
a point or place considerably above most others; eminence; elevation.
a irrigated farmland (esp. paddy land) that is higher than adjacent area.
a non-irrigated farmland that is higher than adjacent area.
= ಕರುವಗೆಯ್.
a house at a higher place than the houses nearby.
= ಕರುಮಾಡ.
the plant Alseodaphane semicarpifolia of Lauraceae family.
= ಕರುಮಾಡ.
to cause to shape in a mould.
to shape in a mould; to mould.
= ಕರುವಿಕ್ಕಿಸು.
= ಕರುವಿಕ್ಕು.
(an animal) to give birth to a young.
the work or profession of shaping objects in moulds.
to be moulded in a matrix.
an old unit of weight used to express the weght of gold or silver in.
one who ploughs the land; a farmer; a husbandman.
drawn (toward); pulled; attracted.
the red fluid, containing various suspended cells, circulating in the arteries and veins of the higher animals; blood.
an enclosure, shed for calves (or in gen. for cattle).
(an animal) to give birth to a young.
(dial.) to fail; to be unsuccessful; to be unable to complete.
the plant Trema orientalis (= Celtis orientalis) of Ulmaceae faly; oriental nettle.
= ಕರುಳು.
to pain deeply; to cause pain to.
= ಕರುಳಿರಿ.
the lower part of the alimentary canal, extending from the stomach to the anus and consisting of the small intestine and the large intestine; the intestine.
the love or natural affection that one has for one's child or children, brother or sister, parents etc.

ಕರುಳಕುಡಿ karuḷa kuḍi one's offspring; ಕರುಳಬಳ್ಳಿ karuḷa baḷḷi close connection of persons by blood; ಕರುಳ ಸಂಬಂಧ karuḷa sambandha relation by blood; blood relation; ಕರುಳಿನ ಕುಡಿ karuḷina kuḍi = ಕರುಳಕುಡಿ; ಕರುಳಿನವರು k aruḷinavaru (pl.) persons related to one by birth; ಕರುಳು ಕರಗಿಸು k aruḷu k aragisu to make one feel pity; to be pitiable; ಕರುಳು ಕರಗು karuḷu karagu (one's attitude, disposition) to become softened; to become gentle and tender; to melt; ಕರುಳು ಕೊರೆ karuḷu kore to pain emotionally and deeply; ಕರುಳು ಮಿಡಿ karuḷu miḍi to feel pained very much; ಕರುಳು ಹರಿದುಕೊಳ್ಳು karuḷu haridukoḷḷu to cut off one's (of a relative) relation.
(fig.) one who kills his own kinsmen.
(fig.) one who exploits his own relative.
a tough string or thread usu. made from the dried intestines of sheep, horses, etc. and used for surgical sutures, for stringing tennis rackets, etc.; catgut.
the twisting of the intestine (which rarely happens in babies in mother's womb).
the intertwined intestines.
to call; to invite; to ask or request to come.
to make a sound (as a bird).

ಕರೆಕಳಿಸು kare kaḷisu to send an invitation to; to ask to come (through another); ಕರೆಕಳುಹು kare kaḷuhu = ಕರೆಕಳಿಸು; ಕರೆತರಿಸು kare tarisu to cause to come (through another); ಕರೆತರು kare taru to bring (a person, animal, etc.) along with oneself; to bring along; ಕರೆದುಕೊ kareduko = ಕರೆದುಕೊಳ್; ಕರೆದುಕೊಳ್ karedukoḷ to receive, welcome or accept (a guest); ಕರೆಯದವರ ಮನೆಗೆ ಕಳಸಗಿತ್ತಿಯಾಗಿ ಹೋಗು kareyadavara manege kaḷasagittiyāgi hōgu an unbidden guest must bring his own steel with him.
to draw milk (from a cow etc.).
to pour down in shower.

ಕರೆಯುವುದು ನೂರೆಮ್ಮೆ, ಕಡಿಯುವುದು ನೀರುಮಜ್ಜಿಗೆ kareyuvudu nūremme, kaḍiyuvudu nīrumajjige in a bid to accumalate money, starve amidst plenty; ಕರೆಯುವ ಹಸು ಕೊಟ್ಟು, ಒದೆಯುವ ಕತ್ತೆ ತರು kareyuva hasu koṭṭu odeyuva katte taru to sell one's advantage for bringing in a misfortune; ಕರೆದು ಉಣ್ಣುವ ಮೊಲೆಯ ಕುಯ್ಯಬಾರದು karedu uṇṇuva moleya kuyyabāradu (saying) do not be ungrateful to one from whom timely help was received.
to hide (oneself) to disappear.
land at or near the edge of a body of water, esp. along an ocean, large lake, etc.; a stretch of rising land at the edge of a body of a river; a bank; shore.
the border on a garment or piece of cloth; hem; ಕರೆಗಣ್ಮಿಸು karegaṇmisu to cause to flow over the bank or boundaries; to cause to overflow; ಕರೆಗಣ್ಮು karegaṇmu to flow over the bank; to overflow.
an act or instance of calling; a call.
the distinctive cry of an animal or bird.
a summons to a meeting.
an act or instance of telephoning; the duration of a telephone call.
an invitation to accept a position.
a calling into action.
the pungent condiment, black pepper (Piper nigrum).
the stem of this plant.
a piece of meat (flesh of animals, used as food).
the colour of charcoal; black colour.
a color, discoloration, streak or spot resulting from or as from staining with dirt, etc.; a stain.
a moral blemish; dishonor; guilt; taint.
the liquid that comes out of a green mango fruit, green plantain, etc. which leaves hard stains on cloth.
that which is true; statement, etc. that accords with fact or reality; the truth.
to fold back the edge of and sew down; to put a hem or hems on; to interwove the end-threads of a blanket, sheet, etc.
the sound made by gnawing while biting with the teeth.
the act of tormenting, as by inflicting constant pain or causing persistent fear, etc.; harassment.
a man who torments, annoys or harasses.
to give way to anxiety or unease; to allow one's mind to dwell on difficulty or troubles; to worry.
to get excited or stirred by zeal.
a stretch of a forest along a stretch of cultivated land.
an electric bell kept inside the house, operated at the entrance, used to call the persons from inside.
a bell used to call a servant or assistant.
a threshing floor made by sprinkling water on, and ramming, the earth.
a stone at the boundary or main entrnce of a village.
a man who hems the border of a garment, dhōti or sari.
to cut slightly the hem of a new garment, sari or dhōti, before wearing (as part of custom).
a plant Aeschynomene aspera of Papilionaceae family; Indian Cork plant.
the act or an instance of calling, inviting.
the act or an instance of drawing milk from a cow, buffalo etc.
an old monetary coin.
the region along the sea coast.
a state or country that has a sea coast, usu. as its boarder on one side, at least.

the plant Anisomeles indica of Lamiaceae family.
a small plant Ruellia prostrata with light blue flowers.
a climber Cryptolepis buchanani, of Asclepiadaceae family; cork screw swallow wort.
a small island in a river or lake, that gets submerged in flood, near the mainland or a larger island; a holm.
the border region or district (of a field, forest, lake etc.).

(pl.) deficiencies and lacunae.
hypocrisy; pretension.

= ಕರೆಬರೆ.
= ಕರೆತ1.
to send an invitation; to send someone to bring another.
to cause to come; to invite to come.

to go or move alongside or towards the sea.

a female elephant.
a man who shows unworthy fear in the face of danger, pain or difficulty; a coward.
powdery earth or other matter in bits fine enough to be easily suspended in air; dust.

its flower.
a physical struggle; a battle; a fight.
the tree Dalbergia latifolia (= D. emarginata) of Papilionaceae family; Indian rose wood.
the bony case of the brain of a vertebrate; the skull.
a building in which elephants are sheltered and fed.

a garland of skulls (worn by Śiva, Kāḷi, etc.).

the fourth sign of the zodiac, entered by the sun about June 21; the Cancer.

its plum; Indian plum.

a stance in sword fighting, keeping both the legs crossing each other.

to cut; to severe; to separate into two or more parts.

absence of light; darkness.

failed or failing to do one's duty.

the fact or an instance of a failure in carrying out one's duty.
a woman who has failed to do her duty.
showing or having a proper sense of duty.

the quality of being dutiful; dutifulness.
